title: datasim_bin
text: function datasim_bin() enables data simulation platform trial binary endpoint arbitrary number treatment arms entering different time points.

title: datasim_bin
text: equal sample sizes across treatment arms block randomization used, factor multiply number active arms order get block size period can specified input argument (period_blocks, default=2)

title: datasim_bin
text: user two options define sample sizes trial:

title: datasim_bin
text: Specify total sample size trial (n_total), number treatment arms (num_arms) timing adding new arms terms number patients allocated control arm (d). sample size per period computed using get_ss_matrix() function. sample sizes treatment control arms varying, based 3 specified parameters assumptions equal sample sizes treatment arms 1:1:…:1 allocation ratio periods.

title: datasim_bin
text: Specify sample size per treatment arm (n_arm, assumed equal) matrix allocation ratios (alloc_ratios) period. matrix sample sizes per period computed based input parameters.

title: datasim_bin
text: period_blocks - number multiply number active arms order get block size per period (block size = period_blocks \(\cdot\) #active arms) p0 - response control arm - vector odds ratios arm lambda - vector strength time trend arm trend - indicates time trend pattern (“linear”, “stepwise” “inv_u”) N_peak - point inverted-u time trend switches direction terms overall sample size full - boolean. Indicates whether full dataset returned. Default=FALSE

title: datasim_bin
text: function outputs dataframe simulated trial data. parameter full set FALSE (default), variables needed analysis included. full=TRUE, dataframe also contains additional information (lambdas, underlying responses).

title: datasim_bin
code: # Usage option 1  head(datasim_bin(n_total = 1000, num_arms = 3, d = 120,                   n_arm = NULL, alloc_ratios = NULL,                   period_blocks = 2, p0 = 0.7, OR = rep(1.4, 3),                   lambda = rep(0.15, 4), trend = "linear")) #> Loading required package: rlang #>   response treatment period #> 1        0         1      1 #> 2        0         1      1 #> 3        1         0      1 #> 4        0         0      1 #> 5        1         0      1 #> 6        1         1      1 # Usage option 2  head(datasim_bin(n_total = NULL, num_arms = NULL, d = NULL,                   n_arm = 200, alloc_ratios = matrix(c(1,1,1,                                                       1,1,NA,                                                       NA,1,1), ncol = 3, byrow = T),                  period_blocks = 2, p0 = 0.7, OR = rep(1.4, 3),                   lambda = rep(0.15, 4), trend = "linear")) #>   response treatment period #> 1        1         0      1 #> 2        1         1      1 #> 3        1         1      1 #> 4        1         0      1 #> 5        0         0      1 #> 6        1         0      1 # Usage option 1 - full dataset  head(datasim_bin(n_total = 1000, num_arms = 3, d = 120,                   n_arm = NULL, alloc_ratios = NULL,                   period_blocks = 2, p0 = 0.7, OR = rep(1.4, 3),                   lambda = rep(0.15, 4), trend = "linear", full = T)) #>   j response treatment period         p lambda0 lambda1 lambda2 lambda3 #> 1 1        1         1      1 0.7656250    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 2 2        1         1      1 0.7656519    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 3 3        1         0      1 0.7000631    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 4 4        1         0      1 0.7000946    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 5 5        0         0      1 0.7001261    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 6 6        0         1      1 0.7657597    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15

title: datasim_cont
text: function datasim_cont() enables data simulation platform trial continuous endpoint arbitrary number treatment arms entering different time points.

title: datasim_cont
text: equal sample sizes across treatment arms block randomization used, factor multiply number active arms order get block size period can specified input argument (period_blocks, default=2)

title: datasim_cont
text: user two options define sample sizes trial:

title: datasim_cont
text: Specify total sample size trial (n_total), number treatment arms (num_arms) timing adding new arms terms number patients allocated control arm (d). sample size per period computed using get_ss_matrix() function. sample sizes treatment control arms varying, based 3 specified parameters assumptions equal sample sizes treatment arms 1:1:…:1 allocation ratio periods.

title: datasim_cont
text: Specify sample size per treatment arm (n_arm, assumed equal) matrix allocation ratios (alloc_ratios) period. matrix sample sizes per period computed based input parameters.

title: datasim_cont
text: period_blocks - number multiply number active arms order get block size per period (block size = period_blocks \(\cdot\) #active arms) mu0 - response control arm. Default=0 theta - vector treatment effects arm lambda - vector strength time trend arm sigma - residual variance trend - indicates time trend pattern (“linear”, “stepwise” “inv_u”) N_peak - point inverted-u time trend switches direction terms overall sample size full - boolean. Indicates whether full dataset returned. Default=FALSE

title: datasim_cont
text: function outputs dataframe simulated trial data. parameter full set FALSE (default), variables needed analysis included. full=TRUE, dataframe also contains additional information (lambdas, underlying responses).

title: datasim_cont
code: # Usage option 1  head(datasim_cont(n_total = 1000, num_arms = 3, d = 120,                     n_arm = NULL, alloc_ratios = NULL,                     period_blocks = 2, theta = rep(0.25, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4),                     sigma = 1, trend = "linear")) #> Loading required package: rlang #>     response treatment period #> 1 -2.0348305         1      1 #> 2  0.4398661         0      1 #> 3  1.6149201         1      1 #> 4  2.7256543         0      1 #> 5  0.4088562         0      1 #> 6  0.7011949         0      1 # Usage option 2  head(datasim_cont(n_total = NULL, num_arms = NULL, d = NULL,                     n_arm = 200, alloc_ratios = matrix(c(1,1,1,                                                         1,1,NA,                                                         NA,1,1), ncol = 3, byrow = T),                    period_blocks = 2, theta = rep(0.25, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4),                     sigma = 1, trend = "linear")) #>     response treatment period #> 1  1.6606923         0      1 #> 2  1.4766618         1      1 #> 3  0.2493255         0      1 #> 4 -0.8675614         1      1 #> 5 -0.5717831         1      1 #> 6  1.1358228         1      1 # Usage option 1 - full dataset  head(datasim_cont(n_total = 1000, num_arms = 3, d = 120,                     n_arm = NULL, alloc_ratios = NULL,                     period_blocks = 2, theta = rep(0.25, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4),                     sigma = 1, trend = "linear", full = T)) #>   j   response treatment period        means lambda0 lambda1 lambda2 lambda3 #> 1 1  0.3080140         0      1 0.0000000000    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 2 2 -0.8132265         0      1 0.0001501502    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 3 3  0.8742809         1      1 0.2503003003    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 4 4 -0.9252002         1      1 0.2504504505    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 5 5  1.0789372         1      1 0.2506006006    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15 #> 6 6 -0.6998368         0      1 0.0007507508    0.15    0.15    0.15    0.15

title: get_ss_matrix
Authors and Citation
text: Pavla Krotka. Author, maintainer. Marta Bofill Roig. Author. Martin Posch. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Krotka P, Bofill Roig M (2022). NCC: Simulation analysis platform trials non-concurrent controls. R package version 1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {NCC: Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls},   author = {Pavla Krotka and Marta {Bofill Roig}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.0}, }

what: Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls
title: Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls
text: NCC package allows users simulate platform trials compare arms using non-concurrent control data. package contains following functions: datasim_cont() simulates data continuous outcomes datasim_bin() simulates data binary outcomes get_ss_matrix() computes sample sizes per arm period linear_trend() linear time trend function, used generate trend patient sw_trend() step-wise time trend function, used generate trend patient detailed description functions, see vignettes R-package website (https://pavlakrotka.github.io/NCC/).

title: Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls
text: consider platform trial evaluating efficacy  treatment arms compared shared control. assume treatment arms enter platform trial sequentially. particular, consider trial starting one initial treatment arm, new arm added every  patients enrolled control arm. divide duration trial  periods, periods time intervals bounded times treatment arm either enters leaves platform. figure illustrates considered trial design.

title: Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls
Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls
Simulation and analysis of platform trials with non-concurrent controls
text: [1] Bofill Roig, Marta, et al. “model-based time trend adjustments platform trials non-concurrent controls.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2112.06574 (2021). [2] Lee, Kim May, James Wason. “Including non-concurrent control patients analysis platform trials: worth ?.” BMC medical research methodology 20.1 (2020): 1-12. Funding EU-PEARL (EU Patient-cEntric clinicAl tRial pLatforms) project received funding Innovative Medicines Initiative (IMI) 2 Joint Undertaking (JU) grant agreement 853966. Joint Undertaking receives support European Union’s Horizon 2020 research innovation programme EFPIA andChildren’s Tumor Foundation, Global Alliance TB Drug Development non-profit organisation, Spring works Therapeutics Inc. publication reflects authors’ views. Neither IMI European Union, EFPIA, Associated Partners responsible use may made information contained herein.

what: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
title: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
text: Simulates data platform trial binary endpoints arbitrary number treatment arms entering sequentially. option either specify timing adding arms overall sample size trial specify sample size per arm (assumed equal) allocation ratios per period.

title: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
code: datasim_bin(   n_total,   num_arms,   d,   n_arm,   alloc_ratios,   period_blocks = 2,   p0,   OR,   lambda,   trend,   N_peak,   full = FALSE )

title: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
text: n_total Overall sample size trial num_arms Number treatment arms trial d Timing adding new arms terms number patients allocated control arm n_arm Sample size per arm alloc_ratios Matrix allocation ratios period (rows = arms; columns = periods) period_blocks Number multiply number active arms order get block size per period p0 Response control arm Vector odds ratios arm lambda Vector strength time trend arm trend Indicates time trend pattern ("linear", "stepwise" "inv_u") N_peak Point inverted-u time trend switches direction terms overall sample size full Boolean. Indicates whether variables needed analysis output (FALSE) also additional information (lambdas, underlying responses) included (TRUE). Default=FALSE

title: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
text: Data frame: simulated trial data

title: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
text: Pavla Krotka, Marta Bofill Roig

title: Data simulation for binary endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_bin
code: # Usage option 1 - specify n_total, num_arms and d head(datasim_bin(n_total = 1000, num_arms = 3, d = 120, n_arm = NULL, alloc_ratios = NULL, period_blocks = 2, p0 = 0.7, OR = rep(1.4, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4), trend = "linear")) #> Loading required package: rlang #>   response treatment period #> 1        1         1      1 #> 2        1         1      1 #> 3        0         0      1 #> 4        1         0      1 #> 5        1         1      1 #> 6        1         0      1  # Usage option 2 - specify n_arm and alloc_ratios head(datasim_bin(n_total = NULL, num_arms = NULL, d = NULL, n_arm = 200, alloc_ratios = matrix(c(1,1,1,1,1,NA,NA,1,1), ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE), period_blocks = 2, p0 = 0.7, OR = rep(1.4, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4), trend = "linear")) #>   response treatment period #> 1        1         1      1 #> 2        1         1      1 #> 3        1         0      1 #> 4        0         0      1 #> 5        1         1      1 #> 6        1         0      1

text: Simulates data platform trial continuous endpoints arbitrary number treatment arms entering sequentially. option either specify timing adding arms overall sample size trial specify sample size per arm (assumed equal) allocation ratios per period.

code: datasim_cont(   n_total,   num_arms,   d,   n_arm,   alloc_ratios,   period_blocks = 2,   mu0 = 0,   theta,   lambda,   sigma,   trend,   N_peak,   full = FALSE )

title: Data simulation for continuous endpoints for a platform trial with an arbitrary number of treatment arms entering sequentially — datasim_cont
text: n_total Overall sample size trial num_arms Number treatment arms trial d Timing adding new arms terms number patients allocated control arm n_arm Sample size per arm alloc_ratios Matrix allocation ratios period (rows = arms; columns = periods) period_blocks Number multiply number active arms order get block size per period mu0 Response control arm. Default=0 theta Vector treatment effects arm lambda Vector strength time trend arm sigma Residual variance trend Indicates time trend pattern ("linear", "stepwise" "inv_u") N_peak Point inverted-u time trend switches direction terms overall sample size full Boolean. Indicates whether variables needed analysis output (FALSE) also additional information (lambdas, underlying responses) included (TRUE). Default=FALSE

code: # Usage option 1 - specify n_total, num_arms and d head(datasim_cont(n_total = 1000, num_arms = 3, d = 120, n_arm = NULL, alloc_ratios = NULL, period_blocks = 2, theta = rep(0.25, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4), sigma = 1, trend = "linear")) #>     response treatment period #> 1  0.2756168         0      1 #> 2  0.1927308         0      1 #> 3 -0.2299197         1      1 #> 4  1.4063490         1      1 #> 5 -1.1381529         0      1 #> 6  1.0488656         0      1  # Usage option 2 - specify n_arm and alloc_ratios head(datasim_cont(n_total = NULL, num_arms = NULL, d = NULL, n_arm = 200, alloc_ratios = matrix(c(1,1,1,1,1,NA,NA,1,1), ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE), period_blocks = 2, theta = rep(0.25, 3), lambda = rep(0.15, 4), sigma = 1, trend = "linear")) #>      response treatment period #> 1 -0.45665792         0      1 #> 2 -0.68008877         1      1 #> 3  0.36833254         0      1 #> 4 -1.60108599         1      1 #> 5  0.09092183         1      1 #> 6  0.48229623         0      1
